彄字的基本解释

彄
kōu
弓弩两端系弦的地方：“桑弰其末刻锲，以受弦彄。”
环子、戒指一类的东西：环彄。指彄。
笔管。
姓。

彄字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kōu］
［《廣韻》恪侯切，平侯，溪。］
(1)弓弩两端系弦处。
(2)借指弓弦。
(3)借指弓。
(4)环状之物。古代射手戴在右手大拇指上用以钩弦的工具，以象骨制成，俗称扳指。
(5)环状之物。笔帽，笔套。
(6)环状之物。戒指、手镯之类饰物。
(7)环状之物。犹套子。
(8)犹搂抱。
(9)谓两手的拇指和食指合拢起来的长度。
(10)抠，用手挖。

彄字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【弓字部】　彄； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页360第36
【唐韻】恪侯切【集韻】【韻會】墟侯切，?口平聲。【說文】弓弩端，弦所居也。　又環屬。【西京雜記】戚夫人以百鍊金爲彄環，照見指骨。　又【荆楚歲時記】歲前爲藏彄之戲。按周處風土記曰：竭恭敬於明祀，乃有藏彄。臘日之後，叟嫗各隨其儕，爲藏彄，分二曹，以較勝負。辛氏三秦記，以爲鉤弋夫人所起。　又姓。【韻會】魯公子彄之後。　【集韻】或作彀。

彄
Basic explanation of words
彄
kōu
The place where the two ends of the bow and crossbow are tied: "Sang Laiqi is carved with a wedge at the end to receive the string."
Things such as rings and rings: ring 彄. Refers to.
Pen tube.
name.
彄
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kōu］
["Guangyun" Kehouqie, Pinghou, Xi. ]
(1) The string at both ends of the crossbow.
(2) By means of bowstring.
(3) By means of the bow.
(4) Things that are ring-shaped. The tool used by ancient archers to hook the strings on the thumb of the right hand is made of elephant bone, commonly known as the finger.
(5) Things that are ring-shaped. Pen cap, pen cover.
(6) Things that are ring-shaped. Jewelry such as rings and bracelets.
(7) Things that are ring-shaped. Still a condom.
(8) Still hugging.
(9) The length of the thumb and index finger of both hands together.
(10) Pull, dig by hand.
彄
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Jixia] [Bow Character Department] 　彄; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 360 Page 36
[Tang Yun] Ke Hou Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Xu Hou Qi, with a flat voice. [Said the text] The end of the bow and crossbow, where the string resides.　And the ring belongs to. [Xijing Miscellaneous Records] Madam Qi uses a hundred alchemy as a ring, see the finger bones.　[Jing Chu Sui Shi Ji] Before the year, it was a Tibetan drama. According to the local customs of the week, it is said: Respect to the Ming sacrifices, there is Tibetan 彄. After the last day, the elders and the elders followed their counterparts. They were Tibetans and were divided into two groups to compare the winners and losers. Xin's Three Qin Records, thought to be caused by Mrs. Gouyi.　Another last name. [Rhyme Club] After the son of Lu.　【Jiyun】Or make a ring.
